generic.translation[0].definitions[0].de: relating to a whole group of things rather than to one thing
generic.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Fine Arts is a generic term for subjects such as painting, music, and sculpture.
generic.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a generic product does not have a special name to show that it is made by a particular company
generic.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a generic product such as a type of food or a drug is one which is sold under its own name, rather than under the name of a particular manufacturer
generic.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The drug Cardizem is also known by its generic name of diltiazem
Cut-price generic brands have stolen millions of customers from the big-name cigarettes.
Smaller companies will increasingly share thegeneric market (=people buying generic products) with bigger brand-name firms.
generic.translation[1].definitions[1].de: generic advertising involves all the makers of a particular product working together to sell the product, rather than competing against each other
generic.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The Video Software Dealers Association announced a funding mechanism for its planned generic campaign.
generic.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a generic word, name etc is used to talk about a whole group of things, and therefore cannot be used as a TRADEMARK
generic.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The court ruled that ‘champagne’ is not a generic word and that wine sold under that name had to be produced in the Champagne region of France.
